title: Lan Tianli
text:
Lan Tianli (; born October 1962) is a Chinese politician currently serving as <a href="Politics%20of%20Guangxi">chairman and deputy party chief of Guangxi</a> and chairman of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Committee of the <a href="Chinese%20People%27s%20Political%20Consultative%20Conference">Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference</a>. He is of <a href="Zhuang%20people">Zhuang</a> ethnicity. He is an alternate member of the <a href="19th%20Central%20Committee%20of%20the%20Chinese%20Communist%20Party">19th Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party</a>.
Biography.
Lan was born in <a href="Yizhou%20District%2C%20Hechi">Yizhou District, Hechi</a>, <a href="Guangxi">Guangxi</a>, in October 1962. He taught at local schools since 1980. After graduating from <a href="Guangxi%20University%20for%20Nationalities">Guangxi University for Nationalities</a> in 1987, he was dispatched to the Science and Technology Commission of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, where he was promoted to its director in 2003. After receiving his master's degree in political economics from <a href="Guangxi%20University">Guangxi University</a> in 1996, he earned his doctor's degree in management science and engineering from <a href="Beihang%20University">Beihang University</a>.
He served as deputy party chief and mayor of Hechi in 2007, and one year later promoted to the party chief position. In 2011 he became vice-chairman of the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region Committee of the <a href="Chinese%20People%27s%20Political%20Consultative%20Conference">Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference</a>, rising to chairman in 2018. In October 2020, the <a href="Central%20Committee%20of%20the%20Chinese%20Communist%20Party">Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party</a> appointed him deputy party chief of Guangxi. On October 19, he was elected chairman at the 19th session of the Standing Committee of the 13th People's Congress of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.
